a.n: Cecile McLorin Salvant Quartet - Jazz a Vienne

p.k: Singer Cecile McLorin Salvant performs vaudeville, country, blues, broadway songs, rarities, and her own compositions. An audience member once described her as a "postmodern cabaret singer".
p.d: 'Jazz a Vienne' is one of the world's most prestigious jazz festivals. Ever since 1981 it has attracted leading jazz artists, with many of them playing return engagements. Unsurprisingly, the festival's 2013 edition did not fall short of expectations: the lineup was filled with the biggest names in music. Among them was the singer Cecile McLorin Salvant performs vaudeville, country, blues, broadway songs, rarities, and her own compositions. An audience member once described her as a "postmodern cabaret singer". The singer is joined on stage by Aaron Dielh on piano, Paul Sikivie on double bass and Rodney Green on drums.
